dublinCore.dc:title: 113 SRES 34 ATS: Commemorating the 150th anniversary of Kansas State University.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Roberts (for himself and Mr. Moran) submitted the following resolution; which was considered and agreed to

form.official-title: Commemorating the 150th anniversary of Kansas State University.

whereas.text: Whereas Kansas State University was established by the Territory of Kansas on February 9, 1858, as the Bluemont Central College Association, in response to the desire to provide higher education opportunities to farm families and working class individuals in Kansas;

Whereas Kansas State Agricultural College, which is known today as Kansas State University, received a land-grant charter on February 16, 1863, making it the first operational land-grant institution in the United States;
Whereas students attending Kansas State University hale from all 50 States and 90 countries;
Whereas more than 200,000 alumni are proud to call Kansas State University their alma mater;
Whereas the commitment of Kansas State University to education is unparalleled; and
Whereas the history and stature of Kansas State University are secured by the exceptional caliber of the educational professionals and students: Now, therefore, be it

section.text: That the Senate recognizes and congratulates Kansas State University for 150 years of fulfilling the mission of a land-grant university.
